* tasks will load from the storage. If there is an error, it will initialise on its own.

* Afterwards, execute the command. The process will keep running until the user types "bye"

* This is the abstract parent Command Class.

public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException, IOException;
* This method is an accessor. It returns the boolean value of running.

* This represents the done command. It is used to change the task from the task list to its
* This is the constructor of the DoneCommand.

public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {

throw new DukeException("Option for Done Command invalid");
* This represents the exit command. It is used to change the running boolean to false.
* Afterwards, during execution, it will write the tasks into the file.

* This represents a Deadline Task. It has a LocalDateTime by object.
* The "by" object will represent the time which the Deadline is supposed to finish.
* The local date time format is in "YYYY
* This is a constructor for the Deadline class
* @param description This describe the task for the deadline
* @param by This represents the date and time of the deadline
this.by = LocalDateTime.parse(by, DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("dd MMM yyyy H:m:s"));
System.out.println("Invalid Date Time set for /by. It will be set to the current " +
"time. Format should be \"dd MMM yyyy H:m:s\" ");
* This is an accessor of the "by" object which represents the date and time of the dateline
* This converts the Deadline to a String object for printing.

* This represents the Event Class. It includes a String at.

* This converts the Event Object to a String for printing.

System.out.println("Task List is loading empty storage");
throw new DukeException("Error: File did not show task format.");
